Using Tape a Talk Pro version for quite some time now, as far as quality and reliability is concerned, the app is great. But now I've a problem, I wanted to take a backup on PC because the directory size has grown a lot but surprisingly out of 63 odd recordings I'm able to see only 22 recording when connecting my phone (Moto X Play) using USB, not sure where are other 41 recordings are. In File Manager App on my phone I can see all the recordings and even the permissions seems to be ok, but on
replyContent: Hi there, that is due to the Android Content provider. Typically a restart helps or you need to wait some time. An alternative would be to use the WiFi transfer feature - this will always show all recordings, and you can access them from your computer. Let me know whether that works for you. Best regards, Markus

content:
Why the hell is every file name now recording rather than the date and 
time? This is the dumbest update imaginable. I'm not going to manually 
change the name to the date and time. Go back to the previous format. I'm 
not going to pay for this.
replyContent:
Hi Steve,

yes, we changed that to have a simpler filename per default. The date is also shown under each recording. If you want the old naming back, use a custom naming scheme in the settings under Path&Filename->Custom Filename, e.g. *YY*-*MM*-*DD* *hh*-*mm*-*ss*

content:
I've been using this app for several years. With the new update, it does 
not record file name under date and time.. instead filename is labeled 
"Recording.wav". When I upload to storage, I cannot see date and time. This 
was the most important feature to me and now I will have to rename file 
manually before uploading.
replyContent:
Hi Tonya,

yes, we changed that to have a simpler filename per default. The date is also shown under each recording. If you want the old naming back, use a custom naming scheme in the settings under Path&Filename->Custom Filename, e.g. *YY*-*MM*-*DD* *hh*-*mm*-*ss*

content: This app is one that I rely on to record notes for one reason: I can put my phone into power save mode and it still runs in the background without missing a beat. I can run it in the background while doing other things in my phone without it silently stopping. The only time it gives up is when I'm hammering my phone with heavy apps like Firefox and Google Maps at the same time. Other recorders I've used silently stop recording with much less provocation.  My only gripes with this app is that it does not have any quality options in between WAV and 3GP. 3GP is horribly low quality and WAV is costing me a lot in terms of storage space. The ability to record directly to a high-quality format like Opus would be very welcome. And please respect my phone‚Äôs rotation setting. When I select ‚Äúauto‚Äù for the orientation setting, I mean to have it behave like other apps and not rotate unless the phone is also set to ‚Äúauto.‚Äù
replyContent: Hi Kevin, first of all, thanks for the detailed review, highly appreciated! We have added AAC support that has a way better quality at low file sizes, please give it a try. Regarding the orientation setting, please send me a mail to clarify further. For us the feature works as expected. Hope to hear from you so we can work on this. Best, Markus

content: Great app BUT if you get the paid version it deletes the recordings you already have. That seriously sucks because I really needed them. You should warn people about that. >:(
replyContent:
Hi Celeste, 
the Pro version uses the same folder that the free version uses, recordings should not be deleted automatically. Please get in touch via mail. Best regards, Markus

content: It's 2017. Why are you still using .wav? .ogg and/or .mp3 should be an option. Both are now freely available.
replyContent: Hi Dave, thanks for your feedback. In the latest version we have added .aac recording support. We are currently checking on support for mp3. Best regards, Markus

content: "THIS IS GREAT".

Can you explain why I cannot name folder on sd card when choosing secondary location,  but more importantly WHY it names it with YOUR name (developers name)? Kind of gives me the feeling you developed a back door into our recordings.
replyContent: Because my name is in the package name and that must be the folder name if you want to store on SD without hassle. Look at the play store page with your computer's browser, there you will find my name in the address as well. And regarding that "backdoor", which actually does not exist - FOR SURE I would name it after me, would be a clever move.

content: I am wondering what to do to send an email? I am in the share part of sending and have filled out all the areas but don't see a prompt to send the file. Please help.

The interface is NOT modern, as it doesn't follow the Android UI guidelines. Though one of the first apps for this purpose, it is quite behind in features. E.g., there is no option to automatically backup files to a cloud. The developer is also not active, and some features that were promised years ago are still not implemented. Settings lack fine tuning and options and there is not enough help. The default setting for high quality produces gigantic files, but if I am willing to compromise the quality a bit to reduce the file size, there is not enough information to guide me on what to tweak.
replyContent: What do you expect? What's not there even though "promised"?

If you contacted me beforehand, I would have offered you a refund as I don't want unsatisfied customers. Leave me an email.

I've been using this quite awhile. It is almost indispensable. When ideas come to mind, I have to record them somehow to hold onto them. I can talk faster than I can type. I use this to record my thoughts, quickly name the file according to the topic, and send it to my email. I listen to it when I can, type up what's worthwhile,  and delete the recording.
It's worth purchasing to support this great app.  It does exactly what it should and nothing that it shouldn't. I like the bigger buttons and save/share options.

I use Tape-A-Talk Pro regularly for long periods of time.  After moving to a Samsung Galaxy S4 from an S3 and updating to the newest version of Tape-A-Talk, I've found it to have a very annoying bug:  If Tape-A-Talk records for long periods, at some point it stops recording, even though it leaves up the red "Recording" signal in the status bar even though it is not recording, which will decieve you when you check on it.  The only way to clear this is to start a new recording and then end it.

Very disappointed. I have the paid version and it failed to record important lectures.  I contacted the developer for support a while back about another issue and never heard back.  Switched to a different recorder and it is much better.
Every android phone I've ever had I've put tape a talk on it. Simple yet well built and does exactly what I needed it to do.  The free version is great I just bought pro to support them.
The only one you should buy
Just what I needed! No need to say more.
Bought the pro to support the dev. Have used the free and the pro version for a while and never a problem!

I don't know what happened. It used to be an amazing app with the crystal crisp high quality sound. But the last couple of updates had made this perfect app with nice simple interface absolutely useless. Even if I speak directly into mike, the output is muffled so hard that I can barely hear my own voice on 44/16 settings (which I always use). Please, fix it. I have Motorola M device.
easy recording for memos and confererence plus it can record phone conversation, a must for those who calls for instruction on how to go to a place, or got lost in the freeway

Stock HTC Thunderbolt running paid tapetalk, set to high quality. NO WAY TO ADJUST MICROPHONE OR INCOMMING CALL VOLUME/CLARITY. There are better apps out there with all these settings. Sorry i bought app; developer is a deadbeat & DOES NOT listen to feedback. DO NOT BUY THIS APP. Developer only supports enough for it to function so you can buy it; no enhancements have been made since running the better paid version daily for a year. Recordings are near worthless; product is $HIT.
This is good tool, but there's no Dev work being done. It needs a feature to record on outgoing or incoming calls and then send them to an email afterwards. Its not THAT difficult

I have both versions. I thought that when purchasing the pro version it would overwrite the basic but keep the recodings. I dont want to remove the basic as i have fear that i could disrupt the pro.  Pro: Great sound quality. Records immediately. Have used it often. Well worth five stars.
Custom file name feature did not work. Too many issue. Cannot trust it for important uses.
Desperately needs a smaller icon, takes up a huge part of my HTC one screen. Something 4x1 please!!!! Actual software is brilliant!
I don't use it all the time, but when I need it, it's great. I wish it would save as MP3 instead of WAV, but that's not a killer for me.

Ive been using this recording APP for a few months now without any problems. It never stop recording until I presses stop.  Other APPs sometimes would stop for no reason, but not this one.  It even continues to record if you get a phone call..tapes also the phone call.  When replaying you can move slide bar to where you need it.  This APP has never crashed for me. FYI, I use Sprint and have a glaxy IIs phone.
fantastic app, thanks for creating

But please please please make it leave the LED light off while recording if screen is off, almost unusable due to this, charge more i don't care, i just would like that and better widget sizes... Functionality is outstanding, just these glitches

It has yet to fully record a session, I start and then, sometime later without warning or indication this POS just stops and I end up with a partial (aka completely useless) recording- if it stops, there's no restarting,   Once (or rather IF) you are able to record a meeting the problems continue. If you reinstall it doesn't recognize existing recordings so you'll need an external player to listen to them.  While you are at it, just stick to the external player- the internal one is as crap as the recording function.  There's no speed adjustment, seeking is basically impossible as there's a tiny line to press with no resolution or auto-skip/replace and it seems unable to skip/speed up etc.   I have no idea why I purchased the pro license for this piece of crap- it doesn't work at all.
I sit in the back of the room in a large college classroom. Recording a lecture comes out crystal clear! Highly recommend!

Fantastic app well deserving of my Pro purchase a while back. Pro cleared up a little bug  with Free about getting a tiny bit of noise in the recording before and after. Pro allows for a higher quality recording (Hz) which is why I can use it to record the church choir I sing in, upload it with dropbox to get it on my home puter to edit with Audacity, save to WAV file, then set up a PodCast with it!  Adequate without spending $300 on an actual digital recorder, though we have one now.  Bravo Dev! LG45C
Really frustrating trying to locate decent Call Record app, and to pay and it STILL not work!!! Refund. Uninstall.
Used this rescently on phone, in a bag, during a hospital appt.  Worked flawlessly and helped megreatly to remember what was said, clarity was good considering where it was... thanks
Could use a quick re record button rather than having to cut the recording.
Widget is nice though too big. (a smaller icon would be better). Does not crash, quality is good. Can't record phone conversations.

I am a guitarist and use this all the time for and audio notebook. It's great for recording an idea and play back later to work on. I have so many ideas that I need this to keep track of them all. HIGHLY RECOMMEND THIS TO MUSICIANS
Great app works great
Its like losing your to do list. And ironically, the app got worse after i purchased the pro version.

Ok, this looks like it's going to be a pretty nice app and useful for my but I'm having an issue with the fact that during playback if you rotate the phone it stops. Driving me a little nuts to be honest.

During playback, the slider lets you seek, but it doesn't move with the audio. In the rename dialog, the buttons "Rename", "Rename+Send", and "Cancel" all have text wrapping in the middle of the words (too long for screen width in portrait). The filename font size is too large, or the clickable lines are too narrow; should have an option for large/small font size and have a larger clickable space for the current (large) font. Turning "Use Custom Directory" OFF causes a popup that is only relevant when turning it ON. Pro icon also has a "pro" label across it while the free version has a plain label; I would prefer a clean icon for an app I pay for; put a "Free" label on the free version instead. Works well functionally, and I found it worth buying, but it definitely needs a bit of work. Will definitely upgrade my rating if I see these things fixed! Otherwise, I'll keep my eye out for another app.

High quality. Feature rich. Simple to use.  Excellent app.

I bought the pro edition, thinking this would be a great app. I went into settings and had it record in high quality (wav). Well it seemed to have recorded something, cause the file sizes are about 50MB for a 30 min recording.   When I try to play it back, Mac, Android, Windows all say it's corrupted. I ended up downloading Audacity and choosing IMPORT >> RAW AUDIO. WIth this I managed to recover the recordings, but they play at chipmunk speed. So I'll need to change the speed of the playback.  I will give 5 stars if this issue is resolved, otherwise I feel like I've invested in a poor product.  FYI: Using HTC EVO LTE

After trying out various recording apps, I finally settled on this one, mostly because it is perfect. High praise to be sure, but the simplicity, tweakable settings, and very simple, very large widget puts this recording app head and shoulders above the rest. Want a professional recording? Buy professional equipment. Want a simple application for off-the-cuff recordings? Part with a fiver, support the programmer, and grab this app.

The benefits I found in this paid version over the free one are that I can choose my external SDcard for saving files and the big buttons along with the widget in that you can run the program without having to open it. As for the no-add feature, it wasn't bothering me in the free version. Anyways, I am satisfied with my purchase.

I needed a voice recording app to use at work to take notes, make reminders, and for general "CMA" voice recordings. This one worked the best and cost less, too.  A bonus is that it can record in standard .wav format. I can transfer the file to my computer and use my Dragon NaturallySpeaking program to transcribe what I dictated. No more having to find another PC program to convert my audio files!

Love love love this app....traveling musician has great idea for a song...cant pull over because I'm on my way to a gig, but I can push a quick button and sing into my phone before I forget it or life happens...and not only that...email it to myself, just in case my phone dies....I  use it all the time and send a chorus here a verse there..

Had a very important Physiology lecture (my professor speaks really fast in order to cover all the necessary material) I had to record... I was so happy to know that I was going to have my recorded lecture to rely on. Got home, to my surprise, it wouldn't play. The "recorded" file was there. Nevertheless, no playback. I figured maybe it was because it was the free version. So, I bought the "pro" version, tried to record an important physics lecture, there was nothing pro about it;same problem! When the app wants to record, it does give good quality feedback. However, it's definitely not reliable/trustworthy at all. Successfully recorded average ratio~ 5:12.
Works well, but the playback volume sounds like a "whisper" even with the media volume set on HIGH volume.

I love the big buttons and the simple interface. I love that it doesn't try to be everything to everyone and make itself a whole lot more complicated in the process.
